titleStmt.title: The prisoners praises for their deliverance from the long imprisonment in Colchester. On a day of publique thanksgiving set apart for that purpose by the gentlemen of the committee of Essex, who for their fidelity in serving their country were surprised by the enemie at Chelmesford. In a sermon upon the sixth, seventh, & eighth, verses, of the CXLIX. Psalm. / preached at Rumford Septemb. 28. 1648. By Samuel Fairclough, pastor of the congregation at Ketton in Suffolk.
titleStmt.author: Fairclough, Richard, 1594-1677.

titleStmt.title: The prisoners praises for their deliverance from the long imprisonment in Colchester. On a day of publique thanksgiving set apart for that purpose by the gentlemen of the committee of Essex, who for their fidelity in serving their country were surprised by the enemie at Chelmesford. In a sermon upon the sixth, seventh, & eighth, verses, of the CXLIX. Psalm. / preached at Rumford Septemb. 28. 1648. By Samuel Fairclough, pastor of the congregation at Ketton in Suffolk.
titleStmt.author: Fairclough, Richard, 1594-1677.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Macock, for Ludowick Lloyd, and Henry Cripps, and are to be sold at their shop in Popes head Alley,

notesStmt.note: Annotations on Thomason copy: "Jan. 8 1649"; the imprint date has been crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
